body:
> Then i make text file in note and save and get error,

Which editor are you using to make the text file?

Have you tried a different one?

Can you attach a log with `-vv` of the problem please?

I suspect that somehow the file is still open when we try to transfer it but the debug log should show the problem.

I attached the log file in first message, editor is notepad. But editor is
not important thing. Then I copy the file to mounted disk, the situation is
the same


вт, 3 мар. 2020 г., 20:36 Nick Craig-Wood <notifications@github.com>:

> Then i make text file in note and save and get error,
>
> Which editor are you using to make the text file?
>
> Have you tried a different one?
>
> Can you attach a log with -vv of the problem please?
>
> I suspect that somehow the file is still open when we try to transfer it
> but the debug log should show the problem.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4031?email_source=notifications&email_token=AORBOJ4ULDILVTXDCQAGPKLRFT2WRA5CNFSM4LAFANL2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOENTKJWY#issuecomment-593929435>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AORBOJ5EN5SROKYGY6FPL4DRFT2WRANCNFSM4LAFANLQ>
> .
>

> I attached the log file in first message

Sorry, I missed that

> editor is notepad. But editor is not important thing. Then I copy the file to mounted disk, the situation is the same

OK.

I will try to reproduce.

I have the same problem (all the same, but Windows7/2008R2 x64).
I try 1.51, 1.50 ,1.49 - it's not work.
But then I try 1.48 - it's working!
I try use FAR Manager or Windows Explorer, it does not matter.
Winfsp 2019.1... 

... But then I reinstalled WinFsp to the latest version 16 (2020), everything began to work fine with rclone 1.51! from the first glance, but then it turned out that the errors still got in and the files were not written.
Hmm... Have you got a recipe for reproduction?

Windows 7/2008R2 x64
RClone 1.51
Winfsp v.16 (2020)

[LocalEncryptedBackup]
type = crypt
remote = E:\LocalEncryptedBackup
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = false
password = ***************
password2 = ***************

C:\tools\rclone.exe --vfs-cache-mode=writes mount LocalEncryptedBackup: z:

When I mount a drive without caching, when I try to copy to a mounted drive using FAR, the system asks for administrative rights, although the mount itself was started without them.
In this case, these errors come out:

The service rclone has been started.
2020/04/01 00:43:36 ERROR : 123/track_1.mkv: WriteFileHandle: ReadAt: Can't read and write to file without --vfs-cache-mode >= minimal
2020/04/01 00:43:36 ERROR : 123/track_1.mkv: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes
2020/04/01 00:43:36 ERROR : 123/track_1.mkv: WriteFileHandle: Can't open for write without O_TRUNC on existing file without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes
2020/04/01 00:43:36 ERROR : 123/track_1.mkv: WriteFileHandle: Can't open for write without O_TRUNC on existing file without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes

After obtaining admin rights, the process of copying without mounting is successful ...

But for each next file this error is issued here:
2020/04/01 00:44:32 ERROR : 123/track_1.mkv: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes
2020/04/01 00:46:27 ERROR : 123/track_2.mkv: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes

.......
I have admin rights, and UAC is ON

And when I try to mount with the parameter  --vfs-cache-mode=minimal 
That such errors are issued here:
The service rclone has been started.
2020/04/01 01:08:09 ERROR : 123/1.zip: Failed to copy: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "29d6cb7890bbb8328f0d2a7c596981a7" vs "8239aae4e224cdc677a6c6fb04924b21"
2020/04/01 01:08:09 ERROR : 123/1.zip(0xc00006c900): failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "29d6cb7890bbb8328f0d2a7c596981a7" vs "8239aae4e224cdc677a6c6fb04924b21"
2020/04/01 01:08:09 ERROR : 123/1.zip(0xc00006c900): RWFileHandle.Release error: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "29d6cb7890bbb8328f0d2a7c596981a7" vs "8239aae4e224cdc677a6c
6fb04924b21"
2020/04/01 01:08:09 ERROR : IO error: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "29d6cb7890bbb8328f0d2a7c596981a7" vs "8239aae4e224cdc677a6c6fb04924b21"

RClone 1.48 works fine with caching (no errors)

Errors appear without caching, but everything works, and NO Admin rights is needed.

The service rclone_1.48.0 has been started.
2020/04/01 01:15:21 ERROR : 123/1.zip: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes
2020/04/01 01:15:37 ERROR : 123/track_1.mkv: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes

At different points in time, I would like to work with and without caching (at example big files writes).

I Have the same problem,:
rclone version:
rclone v1.52.2
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4

winfsp-1.7.20172
Windows 10 Pro 1909
Can you try [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) please?

**All the same**

2020/08/01 13:12:11 ERROR : IO error: vfs reader: failed to write to cache file: The system cannot find the file specified.
2020/08/01 13:12:30 ERROR : hello.txt: Failed to copy: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "67391aeac5fc5996d8c098f15905c6a5" vs "490d3d3c5080e7986f4b98953d0eee29"
2020/08/01 13:12:30 ERROR : hello.txt: vfs cache: failed to upload try #5, will retry in 2m40s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "67391aeac5fc5996d8c098f15905c6a5" vs "490d3d3c5080e7986f4b98953d0eee29"
2020/08/01 13:15:10 ERROR : hello.txt: Failed to copy: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "ec0a44905cace37694699ee8e15be546" vs "490d3d3c5080e7986f4b98953d0eee29"
2020/08/01 13:15:10 ERROR : hello.txt: vfs cache: failed to upload try #6, will retry in 5m0s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "ec0a44905cace37694699ee8e15be546" vs "490d3d3c5080e7986f4b98953d0eee29"
2020/08/01 13:20:10 ERROR : hello.txt: Failed to copy: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "fa82120eec2e9836e5be3bd78629cfb0" vs "490d3d3c5080e7986f4b98953d0eee29"
2020/08/01 13:20:10 ERROR : hello.txt: vfs cache: failed to upload try #7, will retry in 5m0s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "fa82120eec2e9836e5be3bd78629cfb0" vs "490d3d3c5080e7986f4b98953d0eee29"

@snaix can you post your config with the secrets removed and the rclone command you used on the mount.

Also if you could post a sequence of steps for me to reproduce then I'll see if I can reproduce it here - thanks!

I try latest beta
rclone v1.52.2-281-g324077fb-beta, - os/arch: windows/amd64, - go version: go1.14.6
WinFsp 2019.3

[LocalEncryptedBackup]
type = crypt
remote = D:\RCloneTest
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = false
...

It's works:
- without cache:   like early rclone_1.48.0 with error on all written files "ERROR : 1.zip: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without --vfs-cache-mode >= writes"
- with  --vfs-cache-mode=writes: All OK, no errors or warnings, and the files are written successfully

But several times I got a strange result that the file was 2x larger and the first part of its content was filled with 0.
I have not yet found how this happens.

I will test more further

windows 10 pro x64
winfsp 2020 1.7.20172


[lo_crpt]
type = crypt
remote = d:\\\\iokpb_cr\\\\
filename_encryption = off
directory_name_encryption = false
password = *** ENCRYPTED ***
password2 = *** ENCRYPTED ***

PS K:\portable\rclone> .\rclone version
rclone v1.52.2-281-g324077fb-beta
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.14.6


PS K:\portable\rclone> .\rclone mount lo_crpt: p:  --vfs-cache-mode writes
Enter configuration password:
password:
The service rclone has been started.
2020/08/04 17:33:23 ERROR : 776543.txt: Failed to copy: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "fa509e001397d0ba380022fa8573d4a7" vs "7c2dc5d372bdae9a7d9833a9a1262cff"
2020/08/04 17:33:23 ERROR : 776543.txt: vfs cache: failed to upload try #1, will retry in 10s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "fa509e001397d0ba380022fa8573d4a7" vs "7c2dc5d372bdae9a7d9833a9a1262cff"
2020/08/04 17:33:33 ERROR : 776543.txt: Failed to copy: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "9826f255b17799ec3747d2e165ce3938" vs "7c2dc5d372bdae9a7d9833a9a1262cff"
2020/08/04 17:33:33 ERROR : 776543.txt: vfs cache: failed to upload try #2, will retry in 20s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 crypted hash differ "9826f255b17799ec3747d2e165ce3938" vs "7c2dc5d372bdae9a7d9833a9a1262cff"

Had the same issue with `MD5 crypted hash differ` when using (any) vfs-cache-mode on macOS 10.15.6 and rclone v1.52.2.
I have a crypt mount mapping to a local directory.

No issue at all with the latest rclone v1.52.3-290-g82975109-beta

@ncw 
Hi, sorry for late, my config as following:

[remote]
type = s3
provider = Other
env_auth = false
access_key_id =  *** ENCRYPTED ***
secret_access_key =  *** ENCRYPTED ***
region =  *** ENCRYPTED ***
endpoint = *** ENCRYPTED ***
acl = private

The warning message was shown after file transferring, and the file will be missing.
In my test, a big file(about 1GB) tranferring are more prone to this problem, seems a chunk error?

the mount command and 2 errors:

c:\Bin\rclone>rclone mount --cache-dir X:\rclone-vfs-cache\  --vfs-cache-max-age 0h5m0s --vfs-cache-mode=writes remote:kenc-cg S:
The service rclone has been started.

And I will test a beta version for this case.
I'm pretty sure the beta will fix this as you are using --vfs-cache-mode=writes  :crossed_fingers:

Hi @ncw 

Unfortunately, I still have this problem.

The beta rclone version is: 
rclone v1.52.3-328-g0f7a2f0f-beta
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.15

I run the command as:
rclone mount --cache-dir X:\rclone-vfs-cache\  --vfs-cache-mode=writes remote:kenc-cg S:

And copy a file about 1GB to driver S. The file is quickly copied to the cache, and the upload begins.

After uploading(the NIC traffic return to zero), I get the error:
2020/08/25 23:02:30 ERROR : videoplayback.webm: corrupted on transfer: MD5 hash differ "0082dc98c2d1f374cec6f0235ded7d18" vs "362477d565ae74b6c5619dfe719c78cc"
2020/08/25 23:02:30 ERROR : videoplayback.webm: vfs cache: failed to upload try #1, will retry in 10s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 hash differ "0082dc98c2d1f374cec6f0235ded7d18" vs "362477d565ae74b6c5619dfe719c78cc"
2020/08/25 23:05:38 ERROR : videoplayback.webm: corrupted on transfer: MD5 hash differ "0082dc98c2d1f374cec6f0235ded7d18" vs "362477d565ae74b6c5619dfe719c78cc"
2020/08/25 23:05:38 ERROR : videoplayback.webm: vfs cache: failed to upload try #2, will retry in 20s: vfs cache: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: corrupted on transfer: MD5 hash differ "0082dc98c2d1f374cec6f0235ded7d18" vs "362477d565ae74b6c5619dfe719c78cc"

The MD5 "0082dc98c2d1f374cec6f0235ded7d18" is the original file, I don't know what "362477d565ae74b6c5619dfe719c78cc" means.
The problem can be reproduced
BTW, I use a S3 compatible storage but not the amazon's.

I will trace the code for this problem, if I have time. :)
T
